class.name: Transform2D
class.description: Represents one or many transformations in 3D space such as translation, rotation, or scaling. It consists of a two [Vector2] x, y and [Vector2] "origin". It is similar to a 3x2 matrix.

method.name: Transform2D
method.description: Constructs the [Transform2D] from 3 [Vector2] consisting of rows x, y and origin.

method.name: Transform2D
method.description: Constructs the [Transform2D] from rotation angle in radians and position [Vector2].

method.name: affine_inverse
method.description: Returns the inverse of the matrix.

method.name: basis_xform
method.description: Transforms the given vector "v" by this transform basis (no translation).

method.name: basis_xform_inv
method.description: Inverse-transforms the given vector "v" by this transform basis (no translation).

method.name: interpolate_with
method.description: Interpolates the transform to other Transform2D by weight amount (0-1).

method.name: inverse
method.description: Returns the inverse of the transform, under the assumption that the transformation is composed of rotation and translation (no scaling, use affine_inverse for transforms with scaling).

method.name: orthonormalized
method.description: Returns the transfrom with the basis orthogonal (90 degrees), and normalized axis vectors.

method.name: scaled
method.description: Scales the transform by the specified 2D scaling factors.

method.name: translated
method.description: Translates the transform by the specified offset.

method.name: xform
method.description: Transforms the given vector "v" by this transform.

method.name: xform_inv
method.description: Inverse-transforms the given vector "v" by this transform.

members.member: The translation offset of the transform.
The X axis of 2x2 basis matrix containing 2 [Vector2] as its columns: X axis and Y axis. These vectors can be interpreted as the basis vectors of local coordinate system traveling with the object.
The Y axis of 2x2 basis matrix containing 2 [Vector2] as its columns: X axis and Y axis. These vectors can be interpreted as the basis vectors of local coordinate system traveling with the object.
